intro: Nissolia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's nissolia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to habitat loss, Nissolia nelsonii is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
